Storage for each RDS instance (General Purpose SSD (gp2)), Storage amount (30 GB), Quantity (1), Instance type (db.r5.2xlarge), Deployment option (Multi-AZ), Pricing strategy (Reserved 1yr No Upfront)

Group hierarchy: First, In order to save costs I change the EC2 and RDS instances from a pay-as-you-go to a convertible reserved without upfront payment for 1 year scheme, with only this adjustment the cost was dropped from 9,425.66USD to 7,009.07USD, now with a shorter margin to adjust I analyzed that the EC2 instances were primarily for solving http request (web-server and app-server), so CPU and memory are important, and storage is meant only for OS and not transactional, so provisioned IOPS were not of impact, so I changed such storage for a general purpose SSD (gp2) and with this the cost was dropped to 5,707.07 USD

* AWS Pricing Calculator provides only an estimate of your AWS fees and doesn't include any taxes that might apply. Your actual fees depend on a variety of factors, including your actual usage of AWS services.
